result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald M Wierzba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald M Wierzba is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald M Wierzba was found guilty of Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  NO contact with the victim - Donald K. Sr.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
2.  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
3.  Undergo AODA and comply with any recommended follow-up.
4.  Complete a domestic violence assessment and comply with any recommended follow-up.
5.  Get a high school diploma or equivalency and/or seeking or employed full-time.
6.  NO contact with that residence - N5840 Soda Road - Princeton, Wisconsin.
7.  Court allows the probation officer to petition the court for the defendant to go back to the residence and come up with a plan.

records.addlTxt:
11:24 a.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Jeanne Zamzow.

DA recites agreement - defendant plea to count 1 - dismiss count 2.  Attorney Zamzow concurs.  

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  DA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Zamzow.  Attorney Zamzow confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  

Attorney Zamzow enters a plea of NO CONTEST on behalf of the defendant to count 1.  Court goes over the plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court dismisses count 2.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Requests 30 days to submit a request for restitution.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow.  Additional statement by DA.  Additional statement by Attorney Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 36 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
NO contact with the victim - Donald K. Sr.  Court instructs regarding forms of no contact.
Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Undergo AODA and comply with any recommended follow-up.
Complete a domestic violence assessment and comply with any recommended follow-up.
Pay court costs.
Get a high school diploma or equivalency and/or seeking or employed full-time.
NO contact with that residence - N5840 Soda Road - Princeton, Wisconsin.
Court allows the probation officer to petition the court for the defendant to go back to the residence and come up with a plan.

Court adjourned at 11:52 a.m.
from Atty Jeanne Zamzow - can be set for waiver of prelim and plea & sentencing

9:04 a.m.  Defendant present in custody and in court without counsel.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes that bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 9:07 a.m.

Sr.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Court orders bond set at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to have No violent contact with anyone located at N5840 Soda Road - Princeton, WI.
